bill.summary: 10/17/2000--Passed House amended. TABLE OF CONTENTS: Title I: Library of Congress Revolving Funds Title II: Library of Congress Trust Fund Board Library of Congress Fiscal Operations Improvement Act of 2000 - Title I: Library of Congress Revolving Funds - Establishes revolving funds in the Treasury for the following purposes of the Library of Congress: (1) audio and video duplication and delivery services associated with the national audiovisual conservation center; (2) decimal classification, gift shop operation, and document reproduction and microfilming; and (3) the Federal Library and Information Network and Federal Research programs. Authorizes the Librarian of Congress to charge fees for such services and to deposit such fees into the appropriate revolving fund.Title II: Library of Congress Trust Fund Board - Revises the composition of the Library of Congress Trust Fund Board to include the vice chair of the Joint Committee on the Library. Decreases from nine to seven members the Board's quorum for the transaction of business. Provides for a temporary extension of Board members' terms.
